page.title: 03 The "Lavender Cart".
page.content:
In Orlingbury we spoke to a gentleman who remembered about the time before the houses were connected to the main sewers. He told us that the lavender cart was the name given for the cart which travelled around the village for the men to empty the toilets into.The toilets were bucket type and not connected to pipes.The lavender cart came round on Friday evenings much to the embarrassment of the young people who were leaving the dance at the same time as their father was emptying the toilet. Today of course the village has main sewerage pipes and the problem does not arise.
